comments.author: teutonicknight13@yahoo.com
comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.0; en-US; rv:1.9.1.17) Gecko/20110123 SeaMonkey/2.0.12
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.0; en-US; rv:1.9.1.17) Gecko/20110123 SeaMonkey/2.0.12

I click on the RSS tab to subscribe to a particular feed, and the feed will not display in my Mail & Newsgroups listing.

Reproducible: Sometimes

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Click on RSS Feed 
2. Choose which feed to select and click
3.
Actual Results:  
No subscription in Mail & Newsgroups.

Expected Results:  
Taken RSS feed and placed it into Mail & Newsgroups

I click on the RSS tab to subscribe to a particular feed, and the feed will not display in my Mail & Newsgroups listing.

Reproducible: Sometimes

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Click on RSS Feed 
2. Choose which feed to select and click
3.
Actual Results:  
No subscription in Mail & Newsgroups.

Expected Results:  
Taken RSS feed and placed it into Mail & Newsgroups
comments.creator: teutonicknight13@yahoo.com

comments.author: philip.chee@gmail.com
comments.text:
Does this happen with only some feeds or all feeds?

Are there any relevant messages in the Error Console?
Tools->Web Development->Error Console.
comments.creator: philip.chee@gmail.com
comments.raw_text:
Does this happen with only some feeds or all feeds?

Are there any relevant messages in the Error Console?
Tools->Web Development->Error Console.

comments.author: antoine.mechelynck@gmail.com
comments.text:
Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:14.0) Gecko/20120401 Firefox/14.0a1 SeaMonkey/2.11a1 ID:20120401003039

This happens for me with all feeds, as follows:
1. Select a feed under "Subscribe" in the Site Navigation Bar
-- The current tab is replaced by a page asking how to subscribe. The default is "News & Blogs" (i.e., the feed functionality in MailNews). I don't change it.
2. Click "Subscribe Now".

Actual results: Nothing happens.

Expected results: The mailer (in a different virtual desktop) blinks its taskbar icon. When I open it, I should see a new feed folder, busy downloading articles (or, depending on my reaction speed and on number of articles, already having downloaded them).

Haven't checked the Error Console yet, but I will next time.
comments.creator: antoine.mechelynck@gmail.com
